etymology.description: semantic: 貝 “cowry” + phonetic: 卉 for the reading bì; later borrowed to write 奔, giving the reading bēn.
etymology.interpretation: For the bì reading, 貝 contributes the semantic field of valuables/ornament while 卉 provides the sound. In antiquity the graph was also used to write the verb 奔 “to rush,” which yielded the bēn reading; today the ‘rush’ sense is mainly written 奔, while 贲/賁 survives in specialized and classical contexts.
etymology.simplification: 貝 was simplified to 贝 as part of the regular script reforms; the phonetic 卉 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 医生检查了他的贲门(醫生檢查了他的賁門)。
我在读《易经》的贲卦(我在讀《易經》的賁卦)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài dú Yìjīng de bì guà.
examples.english: I’m reading the Bi hexagram in the Book of Changes.
